jgame.controller

Class AbstractIntensityController

  • java.lang.Object
    • jgame.controller.AbstractIntensityController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EntranceExitController, PulsateController

    public abstract class AbstractIntensityController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller
    A controller that controls the intensity of an object on one or more channels.
    Author:
    William Chargin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALPHA
      Indicates that the controller should control alpha.

      The property mask.

      Indicates that the controller should control scale.

        Indicates that the controller should control alpha.

        public static final int SCALE
        Indicates that the controller should control scale.

      • properties

        private int properties
        The property mask. Default is ALPHA and SCALE.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractIntensityController

        public AbstractIntensityController()

    • Method Detail

      • addProperty

        public void addProperty(int property)
        Adds the given property to the control set. The property should be one of:
        • ALPHA
        • SCALE
        Parameters:
        property - the property to add

      • clearProperties

        public void clearProperties()
        Clears the property mask. This is equivalent to calling removeProperty(int) on every property set.

      • controlObject

        public void controlObject(GObject target,
                          Context context)
        Description copied from interface: Controller
        Performs one iteration of controlling the specified object in the given context.
        Specified by:
        controlObject in interface Controller
        Parameters:
        target - the object to control
        context - the relevant context

      • getFactor

        public abstract double getFactor(GObject target,
                                 Context context)
        Gets the factor for the intensity.
        Parameters:
        target - the object to control
        context - the relevant context
        Returns:
        the factor

      • getProperties

        public int getProperties()
        Gets the mask of properties controlled by this controller. You can also use isPropertyControlled(int) to test individual properties.
        Returns:
        the bitmask

      • isPropertyControlled

        public boolean isPropertyControlled(int property)
        Tests whether the given property is part of the control set. The property should be one of:
        • ALPHA
        • SCALE
        Parameters:
        property - the property to test
        Returns:
        true if it is part of the control set, or false if it is not

      • removeProperty

        public void removeProperty(int property)
        Removes the given property from the control set. The property should be one of:
        • ALPHA
        • SCALE
        Parameters:
        property - the property to remove

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(int properties)
        Sets the mask of properties controlled by this controller. You can also use addProperty(int) and removeProperty(int) to set individual properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - the new bitmask

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(int... properties)
        Sets the mask of properties controlled by this controller to the conjunction of all the given properties. You can also use addProperty(int) and removeProperty(int) to set individual properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - the new set of properties
